Module project
Package project.game

Class InventoryBuilder

java.lang.Object
project.game.InventoryBuilder
public class InventoryBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
This class builds an inventory with a gridpane. You may add one item at a time, add multiple at once or remove a specific one after it has been used.

  • Constructor Details

    • InventoryBuilder

  • Method Details

    • addItem

      public void addItem​(InventoryItems item, javafx.scene.image.ImageView tile, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane container, boolean removeTile)
      Inventory building with one specific item. This method will add one item to the inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - Found item.
      tile - Item that is potentially being removed from the scene altogether (depending on boolean).
      container - is the pane of the current scene.
      removeTile - whether or not the tile should be removed from the scene.

    • removeItem

      public void removeItem​(InventoryItems item)
      Removing an item from the inventory after it has been used up.
      Parameters:
      item - that has been used up and gets deleted from the inventory.

    • removeEmptyInventorySpace

      private void removeEmptyInventorySpace()
      Rebuilds the inventory chronologically and refills the empty space that removeItem method has created. EX.: RECORD | KEY | NOTE -> Key is being removed with removeItem() and results in: RECORD | NULL | NOTE -> Null gets removed and note is being taken one space forward with rebuildInventory(): RECORD | NOTE

    • rebuildInventory

      public void rebuildInventory()
      This method will sort the inventory of a player, given the ascending order of InventoryItems.java constants. It may also be used to restore all items in the gridpane if the player has reloaded the game.
